articles.title: CPRK Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
CPRK Blasts S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Remarks
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea released a statement on Thursday denouncing the south Korean authorities for their anti-DPRK outbursts aimed to escalate the confrontation with it. 
					 The chief executive of south Korea at talks and news conference pulled up the DPRK, uttering that "the north must completely dismantle its nukes," "its show of a responsible attitude toward the 'Cheonan' case would be a starting point of the process to improve the inter-Korean relations" and "the north's insistence on its stand would only bring bigger damage to it." He made no scruple of making such arrogant remarks that "only the south-north summit for achieving denuclearization is possible," talking nonsense that the inter-Korean relations are now on a normal track and the improvement of the relations is just a temporary expedient.
					
					 Meanwhile, Minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek, addressing a meeting of the Committee of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Unification of the "National Assembly," claimed that the north has not taken a switchover in its stand on the essential issues of the south-north relations, talking about "a drastic change in attitude" and "healthy and normal south-north relations".
					
					 This is a challenge to all the Koreans and public opinion at home and abroad as it chills their desire for improved relations between the north and the south and peace and an intolerable mockery and provocation against the DPRK sincere efforts, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 A scrutiny into the above-said reckless remarks of the south Korean chief executive and his confidant suggests that they are no more than a declaration made internally and externally that they have not an iota of intention to mend the inter-Korean relations and they are set to persist in the moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities worry about the nuclear deterrent of the DPRK so much, why do they oppose the six-party talks for settling the issue of denuclearization and if the warship case was not a plot, why did they refuse to receive the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the statement queried.
					
					 It went on: 
					
					 Their sophism that the inter-Korean relations are now on a normal track clearly shows what they meant by "healthy and normal inter-Korean relations." 
					
					 What they uttered is intolerable as it revealed once again their sinister intention to stand in confrontation with the DPRK to the last.
					
					 The anti-reunification elements should know that confrontation will get them nowhere. 
					
					 They are so pitiful as to make a silly talk about "change" of somebody, obsessed by a foolish dream, unaware of how the situation has changed and in what direction the trend of the times is heading. 
					
					 It is none other than the south Korean authorities who should make a switchover. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should awake from a foolish dream of doing harm to the fellow countrymen through confrontation, backed by outside forces, and come out for dialogue and cooperation as early as possible. Otherwise, they will face bitterer curse and denunciation from the public at home and abroad. 
					
					 The DPRK will closely follow the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Condolence Messages from Cuban and Algerian Presidents
articles.content:
Condolence Messages from Cuban and Algerian Presidents
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Messages of condolences came to General Secretary Kim Jong Il from Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, and Abdelaziz Bouteflika, President of the Algerian Democratic and People's Republic.
					Upon hearing the news that Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party Korea and first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, died, Raul Castro Ruz and Abdelaziz Bouteflika in their messages expressed profound condolences to Kim Jong Il and the bereaved family of the deceased.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
						
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation headed by Minister Kim Chang Ryong left here on Friday to participate in the international meeting on protecting tigers to be held in Russia.

articles.title: Gifts from Dutch Personages
articles.content:
Gifts from Dutch Personages
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by Chairman Remco Van daal and Secretary General Remco Hellingman of the Dutch Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The gifts were handed to an official of the DPRK embassy in Netherlands on Nov. 15.

articles.title: Autumn Land Management Well under Way
articles.content:
Autumn Land Management Well under Way
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The autumn campaign of land management is going on throughout the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The capital city of Pyongyang is directing great efforts to facelifting streets, parks, pleasure grounds and residential quarters, re-facing public and apartment buildings with coating materials and improving roads.
					
					 In North Phyongan Province main roads extending several dozen kilometers have been constructed or reconstructed and the banks of the River Amnok revetted to prevent flood damage.
					
					 Haeju City, South Hwanghae Province, has renewed its appearance as required by the Songun era, and carried out an embankment project of 35,000 cubic meters along the River Sujong to protect farmland from flood.
					
					 North Hamgyong Province, which has created oil-bearing chestnut tree (Xanthoceras sorbifolia) forests covering a thousand and several hundred hectares and built tree nurseries in many areas in recent years, is taking the lead in the effort for turning the whole country into a thick woodland and greenery. 
					
					 Such undertakings as tree planting, seedling cultivation, railroad reinforcement and bank revetment have made headway in South Hamgyong, North Hwanghae and other provinces.

articles.title: Signal Turn Made in Land Management
articles.content:
Signal Turn Made in Land Management
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Forests covering more than 1.5 million hectares have been created, taking the country as a whole and many roads constructed or repaired and rivers and streams improved in the last decade, making the appearance of the land more beautiful. 
					 A turn has taken place in the production of saplings. Sapling production units in Pyongyang and North and South Phyongan provinces and various other parts of the country have produced saplings of good species enough to create forests of 150,000 hectares every year. 
					
					 The introduction of the technology for producing saplings by use of rotating sprinkling machines, in particular, into at least 150 cities and counties to lay a foundation for increasing the production of saplings at a leaping pace. 
					
					 A popular tree planting movement helped create timber forests of more than 100,000 hectares, forests of economic value covering more than 80,000 hectares, shelter belts of more than 40,000 hectares, firewood forests of more than 110,000 hectares, etc. in the recent three years. 
					
					 Achievements have been made in the road construction and management. New roads with a total length of at least 1,000 kilometers have been built, taking the country as a whole. 
					
					 The project for technologically updating the roads has made progress to remarkably improve the roads linking Pyongyang, Kanggye, Chongjin and Sinuiju and other provincial seats and repair structures of bridges. As a result, the security and cultural level of roads have been further raised. 
					
					 River improvement projects have also made dynamic progress.
					
					 North Hamgyong Province and North Phyongan Province have carried out more than 40 river protection and improvement projects.
					
					 Projects for preventing flood damage have made brisk headway. More than 170 rivers and streams have been improved.

articles.title: Dried Persimmon, Korea's Traditional Processed Fruit
articles.content:
Dried Persimmon, Korea's Traditional Processed Fruit
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Persimmon harvest is in full swing in the middle part of Korea, including Anbyon County, Kangwon Province.
					 Dried persimmon, one of the processed fruits with the longest history in Korea, is tasty and highly nutritive.
					
					 When it is dried, white powder comes out with 75-80 percent of glucose and 20-25 percent of fructose. The mixture is digestive and absorbable.
					
					 Dried persimmon, which can be long stored in any places free from moisture, contains a large amount of sugar.
					
					 It, with vitamin C, B1 and B2, is efficacious for scorbutus, beriberi and other diseases and promotes bodily growth and development.
					
					 It has antioxidant, anticancer, antibacterial and antivirus effects and helps lower cholesterol, blood pressure and blood sugar.
					
					 It also contains kalium, sodium, calcium, magnesium and other ingredients preventing aging.
					
					 Dried persimmon is also used as materials of sweet rice dish and fruit punch.

articles.title: Unprecedented Crime Committed by Japan as Brigand Blasted
articles.content:
Unprecedented Crime Committed by Japan as Brigand Blasted
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists fabricated "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty," depriving Korea of its state sovereignty. This was an unprecedented crime committed by Japan as a brigand.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that the Japanese imperialists fabricated the treaty by vicious military threat and blackmail, the article says:
					
					On the strength of the illegal "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" Korea's sovereignty was mercilessly trampled down and the Korean people were forced to live as colonial slaves with bitter grief over the fate of being a stateless nation. 
					
					 It is an unavoidable duty and the unanimous demand of the Korean nation and world public for Japan to make apology and full reparation for the hideous crimes it committed against the Korean people in the past. 
					
					 But those impudent Japanese reactionaries have dodged honest apology and reparation for their past crimes though more than 60 years have passed since their defeat while talking about the "legitimacy" and "lawfulness" of the documents for aggression fabricated by them to reduce Korea to its colony in the past including the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty".
					
					 The Japanese imperialist are the sworn enemy of the Korean nation as they brought the Koreans so unspeakable misfortune, pain and calamities through the harshest colonial rule in the world history.
					
					 Any further attempt of Japan to cover up its past crimes and dodge making apology and reparation for them would only reinforce the firm determination of the Korean nation to settle accounts with Japan. The towering grudge and indignation of the Korean nation at the Japanese imperialists will touch off its bitterer hatred against Japan and force it to pay for its monstrous crimes committed for more than a century.

articles.title: Intensified Struggle against Imperialism Called for
articles.content:
Intensified Struggle against Imperialism Called for
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- It is the primary requirement for global peace and stability to oppose and condemn the imperialists' aggression and war moves. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
					
					 Noting that the imperialists ignite a war in a moment but make much effort for its preparations in advance, the article underlines the need to heighten vigilance against such moves and wage a vigorous struggle for fully disclosing them. 
					
					 Each country should never allow the imperialists' interference in its internal affairs but solve its own problems by itself in conformity with the interests of its people, it says, and goes on:
					
					 To bolster the self-defensive deterrence is an important guarantee for frustrating the moves of the imperialist to provoke a war and defending peace. 
					
					 A country weak in defense capability will be swallowed up by the imperialists regarding the law of the jungle as the principle of their existence and its people reduced to their colonial slaves. 
					
					 Therefore, the anti-imperialist independent countries and the peace-loving forces should unite to struggle against the imperialists' moves for a war of aggression. This is the task of the times urgently needed to ensure durable peace of the world. 
					
					 Only when the non-aligned movement is strengthened at present is it possible to put the brake on the imperialists' attempt to enlarge their military blocs for aggression. This will also help those countries aspiring after peace and independence against imperialism conduct in unity the vigorous anti-war peace struggle against the imperialist allied forces seeking aggression and war. 
					
					 It is necessary to decisively smash the imperialists' scheme to sow dissension.
					
					 The truth of history shows that in the struggle against imperialism unity leads to victory but disunity to defeat.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Struggle Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Struggle Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- The Committee for the Event to Mark 40th Death Anniversary of Youth Jon Thae Il in south Korea held a memorial service for the fallen fighter in Kyonggi Province on Nov. 13.
					 Attending there were members of opposition parties and civic and social organizations including the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and bereaved families of victims of the Ryongsan tragedy.
					
					 Speakers at the service recalled it is four decades since Jon set him on fire to death in protest against the anti-worker policy of the dictatorial regime, adding that, nevertheless, the authorities have persistently intensified suppression and a large number of workers are committing self-immolation in protest against it.
					
					 They called on the people of different circles to solidarize with each other and turn out in an anti-"government" struggle to get the right to work guaranteed.

articles.title: Feats Performed in Party Building Praised
articles.content:
Feats Performed in Party Building Praised
						
Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- Foreign party leaders who visited the DPRK at the heads of party delegations highly praised President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il for making immortal contributions to founding the Workers' Party of Korea and developing it.
					Zane Carpenter who headed the delegation of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said that a working-class party can creditably carry out its function and role as a staff of revolution only when it is led by a great leader.
					
					The history of the socialist movement clearly shows the position and role of the leader in the revolutionary struggle of the working class, he said, noting that the WPK has demonstrated its might as an experienced and tested powerful revolutionary party enjoying absolute support and trust of the popular masses.
					
					This would be unthinkable without the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					Gyula Thurmer who visited the DPRK heading the delegation of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, had this to say:
					
					The WPK founded by Kim Il Sung has set a brilliant example in socialist construction.
					
					The Korean people are registering spectacular achievements under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who has creditably carried forward the President's cause.
					
					I am pleased that the WPK has made great progress in all fields by embodying the political mode of attaching importance to the military affairs.
					
					Mouhammad Bouchiha who visited the DPRK leading the delegation of the People's Unity Party of Tunisia recalled that Kim Il Sung led the WPK along the road of victory.
					
					He went on: 
					
					The President's revolutionary cause has been successfully carried forward and accomplished by Kim Jong Il.
					
					Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into an ever-victorious revolutionary one with his outstanding ideological and theoretical activities and energetic leadership.
					
					The exploits performed by the peerlessly great men in the party building will shine forever.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, November 19 (KCNA) -- One spring day in Juche 35 (1946) when an agrarian reform was carried out in Korea, Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, went to then Sinhung-ri of Kophyong-myon, Taedong County, South Phyongan Province.
					 She met peasants who had their long-cherished desire for land realized, and encouraged them to do farming well. She then took a basket with grain seeds and a hoe in her hands and entered a field.
					
					 The peasants tried to hold her from doing farm work. But she, with a broad smile on her face, told them she was very happy to sow the field just after the agrarian reform.
					
					 After engaging in sowing without a break, she came out of the field at noon and had a conversation with the peasants.
					
					 A woman who had slaved for a landlord as a farmhand was given 5 000 phyong (a phyong is 3.954 sq. yds.) of fertile land thanks to President Kim Il Sung. Listening to her, Kim Jong Suk said it was really a fantastic story.              
					
					 She also said the President had fought against the Japanese imperialists for many years to realize the peasants' ardent desire and, after the liberation of the country, promulgated the agrarian reform law to distribute land to them.
					
					 Her remark was kept deeply in their mind as a seed of happiness.

articles.title: CRPP condena disparates anti-RPDC de las autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CRPP condena disparates anti-RPDC de las autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica el dia 18 una declaracion condenando los disparates de las autoridades surcoreanas contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El documento sigue:
					
					  En las recientes conversaciones y entrevista de prensa, el gobernante surcoreano acuso a la RPDC con estos dichos: la "renuncia nuclear completa",  la "muestra de la actitud responsable sobre la corbeta 'Cheonan' es el punto de partida de las relaciones Sur-Norte" y "Sera cada vez mas perjudicado el Norte mientras se mantenga obstinado".
					
					  Y no vacilo en decir unas palabras tan insolentes como que "las relaciones Sur-Norte marchan ahora en la orbita normal y el mejoramiento de ellas no pasa de ser una solucion momentanea" y "es posible solo la reunion cumbre Sur-Norte para alcanzar la meta de desnuclearizacion".
					
					  Por su parte, el ministro de Reunificacion Hyon In Thaek hablo en el Comite de Diplomacia, Comercio y Reunificacion de la "Asamblea Nacional" del supuesto "cambio radical de la actitud" y las "relaciones sanas y normales entre el Sur y el Norte" sosteniendo que el Norte no cambia su posicion en cuanto a los problemas esenciales de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					  Esta chismografia deviene un acto desafiante que desalienta a todos los coreanos y la opinion publica interna y externa, que desean la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur y la paz, e intolerable burla y provocacion a los sinceros esfuerzos de la RPDC.
					
					  Si se analiza los disparates del gobernante y su subdito fiel, resulta claro que ellos no quieren ni en lo minimo la solucion del problema de relaciones Norte-Sur, sino declararon esta vez al interior y al exterior del pais su voluntad de seguir recurriendo al complot y al enfrentamiento contra la RPDC.
					
					  Si a las autoridades surcoreanas les preocupa tanto el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC, no tendrian el motivo de rehusar las conversaciones a 6 bandas para solucionarlo.
					
					Si el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" no fuera un complot, tampoco tendrian inconveniente en aceptar al grupo de inspeccion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC para la investigacion en el terreno.
					
					  "Las relaciones Sur-Norte marchan ahora en la orbita normal" - este disparate de las autoridades surcoreanas demuestra claramente cuales seran las "relaciones sanas y normales Sur-Norte" de que hablan ellas.
					
					  No se puede admitir nunca esos disparates que volvieron a revelar la malsana ambicion de enfrentarse hasta el final con la RPDC.
					
					  Los elementos anti-reunificacion deben saber que no podran alcanzar nada con la confrontacion.
					
					  !Que miserables son los tipejos que cautivados de su necia ambicion, hablan tanto del "cambio" de alguien sin darse cuenta de como van la situacion y la corriente de la epoca!
					
					  Los que deben cambiarse son precisamente las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					  Ellas deben acceder cuanto antes al dialogo y a la cooperacion liberandose de su absurda ilusion de perseguir la confrontacion y atacar a los connacionales con las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					  De lo contrario, seran condenados y denunciados mas fuertes por los nacionales y extranjeros.
					
					  La RPDC seguira de cerca la actitud de las autoridades surcoreanas.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presentes de personalidades holandesas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presentes de personalidades holandesas
						
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio los regalos que con motivo del 65o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea le dirigieran Remco Van daal y Remco Hellingman, presidente y secretario general del Grupo Holandes para el Estudio de la Filosofia Juche.
					Los presentes fueron entregados el dia 15 a un funcionario de la embajada coreana acreditada en Holanda.

articles.title: Se dinamiza en Corea administracion territorial de la estacion otonal
articles.content:
Se dinamiza en Corea administracion territorial de la estacion otonal
						
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Toma auge en distintas localidades del pais la administracion territorial de la estacion otonal.
					En esta capital se lograron muchos exitos en el ordenamiento de avenidas, parques, lugares de recreo y repartos de viviendas, donde se llevo a cabo la pintura de paredes exteriores, y en la reparacion de la vialidad.
					
					La provincia de Phyong-an del Norte ha concentrado las fuerzas en la construccion y la reedificacion de las principales carreteras de decenas de km de largo y ha reforzado por otra parte el malecon a las riberas del rio Amnok para prevenir los danos de inundaciones.
					
					Partiendo de su patriotismo y amor a su pueblo natal, los trabajadores de la ciudad de Haeju de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur se movilizaron unanimemente en la urbanizacion para acondicionar su tierra natal conforme a la demanda de la epoca del Songun.
					
					En un corto tiempo, renovaron totalmente el aspecto de la ciudad, acumularon 35 mil metros cubicos de tierra y arreglaron el riachuelo Sujong, de modo que muchas tierras cultivables se protegieran del desborde del rio.
					
					Mientras tanto, la provincia de Hamgyong del  Norte acondiciono en los ultimos anos mil y centenares de hectareas del bosque de castanos oleaginosos.
					
					Este ano tambien, marcha al frente en la reforestacion de todo el pais realizando segun la normativa tecnica la siembra de semillas y el abonamiento de ellas y preparando en varios lugares las almacigas con vistas al futuro.
					
					Otras provincias incluyendo las de Hamgyong del Sur y de Hwanghae del Norte lograron gran avance en los proyectos de administracion territorial, tales como la formacion de areas boscosas, el aseguramiento de semillas de arboles, el arreglo de ferrocarriles, las obras de proteccion de la ribera, etc.

articles.title: Logrados grandes exitos en la administracion territorial
articles.content:
Logrados grandes exitos en la administracion territorial
						
Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Aparecio en los ultimos 10 anos en Corea un area forestal de mas de millon 500 mil hectareas.
					Ademas, se construyeron y se repararon muchas carreteras y se arreglaron los rios, de modo que luzca mas pintoresco el territorio nacional.
					
					Al lograrse un viraje en la produccion de posturas de arboles, se cultivaron las posturas de buena variedad capaces de crear un area boscosa de 150 mil hectareas en cada ano en los viveros de distintas localidades como la ciudad de Pyongyang, las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Sobre todo, se aplico en mas de 150 ciudades y distritos la tecnica de produccion de posturas con el aparato giratorio de pulverizacion.
					
					Por eso, se sento la base de aumentar vertiginosamente la produccion de plantones.
					
					Durante los ultimos 3 anos, gracias al movimiento masivo de siembra de arboles, fueron creados mas de 100 mil hectareas de bosque maderero, mas de 80 mil de bosque de uso economico, mas de 40 mil para la proteccion y mas de 110 mil de lenas.
					
					Tambien, fueron logrados buenos exitos en la construccion y el mantenimiento de la vialidad como la construccion a lo largo del pais de nuevas carreteras con una extension de miles de kilometros en total.
					
					Al promoverse la reconstruccion tecnica de las carreteras, fueron remozadas las calles que enlazan la ciudad de Pyongyang y las capitales de las provincias, incluyendo Kanggye, Chongjin y Sinuiju.
					
					Igualmente, quedaron reparados los puentes asegurando la solidez y la apariencia cultural de la vialidad.
					
					Tambien, se realiza con dinamismo el ordenamiento de recursos fluviales.
					
					   Fueron efectuadas las obras de proteccion riberena en mas de 40 puntos en las provincias de Hamgyong del Norte y de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Se realizaron las obras para prevenir los danos de inundaciones y se arreglaron mas de 170 recursos fluviales.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun vuelve a condenar el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun vuelve a condenar el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa"
  Pyongyang, 19 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Es un acto criminal sin precedente el hecho de que el imperialismo japones arrebato la soberania nacional de Corea en virtud del inventado "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa".
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este viernes y continua:
					
					  Hay muchos datos reveladores de que Japon invento a punta de bayonetas ese tratado ilegal que privo a Corea de su soberania e impuso al pueblo coreano la amarga vida de esclavo colonial y apatrida.
					
					  Japon debe pedir disculpas por sus enormes crimenes cometidos en el pasado contra el pueblo coreano e indemnizarlos consecuentemente. Esto es su deber ineludible y la unanime demanda de toda la nacion coreana y la opinion publica mundial.
					
					  Pero, hasta hoy a mas de 60 anos de su derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, los descarados reaccionarios japoneses eluden esa obligacion alegando la "legalidad" y la "legitimidad" de los documentos leoninos inventados, incluyendo el "Tratado de 5 Puntos de Ulsa", para colonizar a Corea.
					
					  Es enemigo jurado de la nacion coreana el imperialismo japones que infligio a la primera indecibles desgracias, sufrimientos y desastres con el coloniaje mas barbaro de la historia mundial.
					
					  A medida que Japon posponga pedir disculpas e indemnizar disimulando sus crimenes del pasado, sera cada vez mas firme la voluntad de la nacion coreana de ajustar la cuenta hasta el final con ese pais isleno.
					
					  La nacion coreana, que guarda un tremendo rencor al imperialismo japones, cobrara sin falta mil veces el precio de los crimenes, cometidos por Japon durante mas de 100 anos, descargando su odio acumulado.
